intro: Pyrola minor, commonly known as the dwarf wintergreen, is a low-growing evergreen herbaceous plant native to the northern hemisphere. It typically reaches a height of only a few centimeters, with a rosette of broad, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, appearing in late spring to early summer. Pyrola minor thrives in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rock crevices. Its leaves and flowers contain aromatic compounds, contributing to its medicinal and ecological significance.
